result.execSummary:
The defendant Cindy Marie Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cindy Marie Thompson

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot, ADA: Micheal Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Cindy Marie Thompson appeared from jail. PO Sonnenberg also present. Includes 14CF319, 14CF393, 14CF430. Case called at 11:02 am. Court reviews files and questions re: PSI. ADA Nieskes makes statement. Atty Harrelson makes statement. C. Thompson makes statement. Recess. Case recalled at 11:42 am.
Court orders:

14CF393
2 yrs 6 mo i/c, 3 yrs e/s

14CF430
2 ys i/c, 3 yrs e/s

- Court Costs; Apply bond on file
- AODA
- Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation
- Cooperate with any assessment, evaluation and/or correctional program as directed by agent
- DNA Sample and Surcharge.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to possess a firearm
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow all rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay Supervision fees
- 154 Days credit

On 14CF319
- 9 months 
concurrent to 14CF393 and 14CF430
Sentencing hearing on February 2, 2015 at 11:00 am.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Webb, ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Cindy Marie Thompson appeared.  Court called at 9:17 a.m.  Includes case 14CF319, 14CF393 & 14CF430.  Set for sentencing.  Court has not  reviewed correspondence filed by Attorney Harrelson on 01/28/15.  Court wants time to review the documents.  Court continues SEH.   Court advise Ms. Sonnenberg does not have to appear in person and court grants permission to appear by phone.  Court adjourned at 9:24 p.m. lw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 11:00 am.
signed by Defendant and Attorney this date. eif
filed by Atty Jeremiah Harrelson w/Sentencing recommendations. eif

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Fox, ADA:   Matthew L. Hartung, DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF:  Cindy Marie Thompson appeared from jail. Includes 14CF430, 14CF319, 14CF393, 14CF366 and 14CF390. Court reviews plea questionaire with def. Def understands. 
DE pleads guilty to 14CF319 count 2 (misd. theft); 14CF393 count 1 (felony theft); and 14CF430 count 1 (Felony Bail Jumping). 
Court reviews charges/maximum penalties and constitutional rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. 
Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 in 14CF319, ct 1 in 14CF393 and ct 1 in 14CF430. 
Count 1 in 14CF319 is read-in for purposes of sentencing and dismissed. 
Count 2 in 14CF393 is dismissed 
Counts 2, 3 and 4 in 14CF430 are read in for purposes of sentencing and dismissed. 
Atty Hartung moves to dismiss 14CF366 and 14CF390. Court dismisses 14CF366 and 14CF390.
Crt orders a PSI.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 26, 2014 at 02:15 pm.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot, ADA: Michael Nieskes, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF: Cindy Marie Thompson appeared from jail.  Court called  10:10 a.m. Court is questioning the DE prescription pill bottle.  Attorney Harrelson has not been able to get a hold of family members to get the pill bottle the Court is requesting.  Attorney Harrelson makes arguments regarding modifying the bond.  ADA Nieskes is asking the bond to deny the bond modification.  Court questions the DE.  Court asks Attorney Harrelson to contact the son to get the pill bottle today and to have the DE tested.  Court ask the jail to notify the Court as soon as they know the results.   If negative for the UA the Court will ask the DE be brought back up this afternoon.  Court adjourned at 10:17 a.m. lw

and _X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $4500.00 and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- Report every other day by 2:00 pm to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If Defendant test positive she must pay $5.00. 

- To report for testing on 9/15/2014, bring in new prescription to the Jail with prescription bottle. 

-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Shopko.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
